worklogs.comment:
anthonylouisbsb opened a new pull request, #13485:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13485

   Since June 24 the nightly build is generating multiple jars for the same module.
   
   In that example: https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/releases/tag/nightly-packaging-2022-06-24-0-github-java-jars you can find three different jars for the arrow-gandiva.
   
   The commit purpose is clean the .m2 folder before executing the clean install command and copy the artifacts to the folder where they will be uploaded.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
Since June 24 the nightly build is generating multiple jars for the same module.

In that example: [https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/releases/tag/nightly-packaging-2022-06-24-0-github-java-jars] you can find three different jars for the arrow-gandiva.

I looked at the scripts for java build, the jinja macros that upload the artifacts, and the YAML file that defines the job for java jars, and all files were not changed recently. Maybe it is a problem inside the environment where the job is running.
fields.summary: [Java][Packaging] Nigthly build is generating excessive jars

comments.body:
CC: [~kszucs] [~kou] 

Can you help me with that? As I described, the scripts were not changed. I do not know why it started to fail
I think I found the problem we are copying the jars from the .m2 repository and it may have some garbage. I made a patch fixing it

It seems that a self-hosted GitHub Actions runner provided by Voltron Data is used since 2022-06-23.

2022-06-22 job https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/runs/7000855194?check_suite_focus=true uses {{/Users/runner/}} but
2022-06-23 job https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/runs/7027946353?check_suite_focus=true uses {{/Users/voltrondata/}}.

[~raulcd] It seems that java-jars nightly job uses self-hosted runner with {{runs-on: macos-latest}} since 2022-06-23. Do you know why it is occurred?

* 2022-06-23 job log: https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/runs/7027946353?check_suite_focus=true
* 2022-06-23 workflow file: https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/actions/runs/2547855667/workflow#L123

Hi [~kou] , I can see there is a new MAC self-hosted runner on crossbow called: i7mini03  with the following tags: "self-hosted" "  macOS" "  X64" "  devops-managed" "  intel" "  macos-latest" "  macos-11"

Which is probably the reason. [~assignUser] do you know anything about this runner?

!image-2022-07-01-10-53-58-490.png|width=595,height=350!

Yes this was added intentionally. MacOS github runners are currently extremely scarce, to alleviate that we added a powerful intel mac (16 cores 32GB). After testing it with different workflows we added the tags "macos-latest" and "macos-11" so we don't need to add new tags (and make the wfs run on self-hosted only, which would than be a bottle neck again). We also added a cleanup step that removes changes to brew and the working dir. As the maven repo is in ~ this was unaffected but we can add that to the cleanup step of the runner.

> As the maven repo is in ~ this was unaffected but we can add that to the cleanup step of the runner. 

Could you do it?
Yes, the repo should get cleaned now, I'll confirm on monday. (y)
